intro: Millettia usaramensis subsp. australis, commonly known as the Australian millettia, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Southeast Asia and northern Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. The subspecies australis is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from other subspecies of Millettia usaramensis.
